intro: Nepeta caesarea, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly fuzzy texture. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its nectar-rich flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
